column3: What is the national bird of NZ?
column9: Kiwi is a nocturnal flightless native to New Zealand.

column3: What is the Maori name for New Zealand?
column9: It means the Land of Long White Cloud.

column3: The Kiwifruit was originally called what?
column9: The term Kiwifruit did not come into use until the 1970s

column3: Whose head will you find on all New Zealand coins?
column9: Queen Elizabeth is head of state in New Zealand which is a member of the Commonwealth

column3: Name the sea that lies between Australia and New Zealand.
column9: Named for Dutch explorer Abel Tasman

column3: What is the name of the New Zealand international rugby team?
column9: Their uniforms are black in color

column3: The North Island is the ____ biggest island in the world.
column9: The South island is the 14th largest

column3: Which river runs through the city of Hamilton?
column9: The Waikato River is also the longest in NZ

column3: What is the Capital city of New Zealand?
column9: Wellington is centrally located for both the North and South Islands

column3: Which is the longest river in the South Island?
column9: The mighty Clutha river is the largest by volume in New Zealand

column3: What is the famous treaty that New Zealanders get a holiday for?
How many stars are there in the New Zealand flag?
column9: These stars represent the constellation of Crux

column3: Who became prime minister of New Zealand in 2016?
column9: Bill English is a member of the National Party.
